channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2024040365
item.description:
Report E-2024040365

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: RUSTON
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a roadside release of Kurifloc 7115 from a 275-gallon tote as a result of improper loading / inadequate preparation for transportation. The tote became crushed under falling freight breaking the cap and causing the release during transit. Approximately 10-gallons of product released onto the trailer floor, the asphalt beneath the trailer, and the concrete parking lot. The impact areas include the trailer floor: 4'x4', asphalt beneath the trailer: 2'x8', and concrete parking lot: 3'x20'. A Contractor secured the freight for the trailer to pull into a parking lot where a tote transfer was performed and the trailer floor was neutralized with white vinegar. The transferred tote was loaded onto trailer while the damaged tote was taken by the Contractor to XPOâ€™s Shreveport, LA terminal to be cut-up and containerized for waste disposal. Additionally, one drum containing PPE, impacted oil dry, and impacted absorbent rags was generated for waste disposal. No storm-drains, soil, or waterways were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024040625
item.description:
Report X-2024040625

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: CARENCRO
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon opening trailer, empty hazmat box fell out of trailer. Box was open and ripped on top. 4 gallons of Alcohol were inside trailer with packages under them. One gallon had cap that was loose and fell off. Seal under cap was ruptured and gallon of Alcohol leaked out onto floor of trailer. DescribePack: Cap was loose and fell off of gallon. Seal under cap was ruptured and Alcohol leaked out . DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Immediately upon discovery of damaged hazmat package, contents, and all other packages that liquid leaked onto were placed inside blue hazmat bag, then placed into hazmat tote and taken to hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024040533
item.description:
Report X-2024040533

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: CARENCRO
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found laying upside down on a pallet next to van line. Package was taken to Hazmat cage for processing. Upon inspection discovered inner plastic cylinder was cracked on bottom and Calcium hypochlorite was spilling into box. DescribePack: Large crack running along complete bottom of cylindar. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in blue hazmat bag and then hazmat tote. Package was taken to hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024040532
item.description:
Report X-2024040532

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found by the QA cage. The package was a pick up from the previous day, and somehow was damage at night. The package was inspected by QA, and the invoice stated it was a hazardous product. No labeling on the box to state that it was hazardous. DescribePack: The paint can busted from the top and the bottom of the can. The paint was wrapped in paper but was not secured enough. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a proper tote and processed properly.

item.title: Report E-2024040368
item.description:
Report E-2024040368

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While completing a routine 10-Day facility inspection, a Veolia employee noticed a wet spot under a pallet of drums. Upon further inspection the employee noticed a pinhole on the side of the drum approximately 10 inches from the top. Approximately 1 gallon of material leaked from the drum through the pinhole throughout the weekend. The drum was overpacked and the spill was cleaned using oil dry.

item.title: Report X-2024040402
item.description:
Report X-2024040402

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the trailer by a manger and they noticed the paint spilling from the trailer. The paint package was already damage at another terminal by another QA person but they didn't do the proper process to the hazmat. The hazmat is being processed properly after the manager notified QA about it. It was placed in a red tote and moved the hazmat area. DescribePack: The package contained four paint buckets with all of them damaged. The cans were empty by the time it got to BATO FedEx facility. All cans were punctured from either the top or the bottom of the cans. There was no inner packing to stop the package from getting damaged. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a red tote when it was brought to the attention of QA, and placed in the hazmat cage to be processed properly.

item.title: Report X-2024040365
item.description:
Report X-2024040365

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the trailer damaged with the corner of the box wet and the strong smell was coming off the package. The manager notified QA of the possible damage. After QA saw that the package was damaged, QA got a red tote and placed the hazmat in the hazmat area to be processed. DescribePack: The can was noticeable wet and the cap was a little loose. The package was packed with some simple cardboard covering the cans but it wasn't enough to keep the cans from getting damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a red tote to be processed properly in the hazmat area

item.title: Report E-2024040222
item.description:
Report E-2024040222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSL experienced a UN3082 Zinc Sulfate Solution 33 - 36% release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 10â€™ x 30â€™ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
